poem:
**Echoes of Beirut**

Sirens twist through
the threaded street—
jagged tears in
sun-drenched linen.
Voices wail from ovens,
mirrors,
pavements sharp
with punctuation.
Glass shatters in 
kitchens, 
hospitals,
coffee cups rattling
in barber shops,
the city, a mosaic of
breath halted,
waiting.
